Key Match Events: India won the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup final against South Africa by seven runs.
Virat Kohli scored 76 runs off 59 balls.
Jasprit Bumrah bowled a miserly 18th over, conceding only two runs and taking a wicket.
Suryakumar Yadav took a crucial catch to dismiss David Miller in the last over.
Axar Patel and Virat Kohli had a 72-run fourth-wicket partnership.
Hardik Pandya took three wickets for 20 runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli announced their retirement from T20Is after the match.
Rohit Sharma expressed that the victory was a result of efforts over the past 3-4 years.
Virat Kohli showed emotional relief and pride after the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India scored 176/7 after winning the toss.
South Africa was restricted to 169/8 in their chase.
The match was held at Kensington Oval, Bridgetown.
